a-collection-of-tips-to-become-a-softwar.title: A Collection of Tips to Become a Software Engineer
a-collection-of-tips-to-become-a-softwar.description: Over the years I have been on both sides of the interview process. I have learned a wealth of experience, here is my advice.

code-to-production.title: Software Engineers Rush to Write Bad Code
code-to-production.description: Engineers are pushed to write code quickly and the quality suffers because of it. How can you move quickly while maintaining a high level of quality?

combining-hobbies.title: Combining Hobbies: Programming, Electronics & Photography
combining-hobbies.description: This is an exploration into learning more about photography by building a camera.

failing-at-kickstarter.title: What I learned from Failing with Kickstarter
failing-at-kickstarter.description: In 2016, I set out to launch my first product on Kickstarter. I failed, did some research, tried again and succeeded. These are my observations.

finish-what-you-start.title: Finish What You Start
finish-what-you-start.description: I love starting hobby projects. However, I seem to hate finishing them. Let's figure out how to finish things.

how-to-build-a-circuit-board.title: How to Build a Circuit Board
how-to-build-a-circuit-board.description: One Day I decided to learn how to make circuit boards. Several months later, my first PCB arrived in the mail. This is how I got there.

how-to-make-a-photo-stitching-website.title: How to Make a Photo Stitching Website & Avoid Burnout
how-to-make-a-photo-stitching-website.description: Engineers love to start side projects and never finish them. This leads to burnout. Why not build fun things instead? How about a tool to develop virtual cross stitches!

learning-to-learn.title: Learning to Learn: Develop Skills to Master Anything
learning-to-learn.description: In the pursuit of learning about electronics and other subjects, I have developed a set of skills that have enabled me to learn new subjects more quickly and thoroughly and with less frustration.

on-failing.title: What it Means to Fail
on-failing.description: I marked my service in the Peace Corps as a failure. After much reflection on that summarization, I realized there is more than one way to look at failure.

storytelling-in-presentation.title: Storytelling in Presentation
storytelling-in-presentation.description: Ever wanted to improve your ability to convey what's in your head to your audience? This talk is for you!

talking-technical-with-non-technical-tal.title: Talking Technical With Non Technical Talkers
talking-technical-with-non-technical-tal.description: This is my first technical talk! I wanted to share with the world what I've learned working with folks from different backgrounds and disciplines.

teach-anyone-anything.title: Sharing What You've Learned with Others
teach-anyone-anything.description: I have learned a lot along the way and I'll share those lessons learned here.

time-management-and-productivity.title: Time Management & Productivity
time-management-and-productivity.description: I have gotten very good at managing my time over the years, here is how I do it.

virtual-team-building-event.title: How to organize a virtual team building event
virtual-team-building-event.description: So you want to organize a virtual team outing? We put together a quick guide to help with research, planning, and the actual event.

what-we-lost-when-we-went-remote.title: What we Lost When We Went Remote
what-we-lost-when-we-went-remote.description: These are my observations as the world went remote and team dynamics went online.

resume-as-code.title: Resume as Code
resume-as-code.description: Text editors are great for writing code. But what if we used them to write our resume?

leaving-aws.title: Escaping Surprise Bills & Over-engineered Messes: Why I Left AWS
leaving-aws.description: Frustrated with AWS's complexity and cost risks, I switched to NearlyFreeSpeech for its prepaid model, ensuring financial control while keeping hosting simple and flexible.

somehash.title: Somehash: A Blurhash Inspired Exploration
somehash.description: The time between visiting a website and seeing its content fully loaded offers creative space to capture a user's attention and keep them from leaving.
